sentences.sContent: We oppose racism in all its forms.
sentences.sCn: 我们反对各种形式的种族主义。

sentences.sContent: The female form is a thing of beauty.
The rocks were formed more than 4,000 million years ago.
sentences.sCn: 这些岩石是40多亿年前形成的。

sentences.sContent: ...organisations increasingly use “team” as a verb rather than a noun: they form teams for specific purposes and then quickly disband them...
...One ancient form of egg art comes to us from Ukraine...
...the conventional form of organisation is giving way to a network of teams...
...in addition to a second form of nicotine replacement...
...He believes students ultimately learn more and encourages them to form study groups...
...Then you must complete this form and pay a fee...
...For me it took the form of my first...
...90% of parents said that their children younger than 2 consumed some form of electronic media...
...More than one in eight people in their late 50s is now on some form of federal disability insurance program...
...Perhaps the primary reason lies that the form far outweighs the content...

synos.tran: 形式，形状；形态，外形；方式；表格
构成，组成；排列，组织；产生，塑造

phrases.pCn: 有礼貌的；正确的姿势；良好的姿势
(运动员、赛马等)能发挥自己的水平，竞技状态良好；精力旺盛[亦作 on top form]
艺术形式（尤指文学，绘画，音乐，民歌等）

words.tran: 正式的；拘谨的；有条理的
没有形状的；无定形的；形体不明的
模型，样板；起形成作用的人
正式的社交活动；夜礼服
礼节；拘谨；仪式；正式手续
使正式；使有效（formalize的过去分词）；使定形；拘泥于形式
使形式化；使正式；拘泥礼仪

trans.tranOther: the way something is or appears to be
to start to exist, or make something start to exist, especially as the result of a natural process
